section.title: Introduction
section.para: This article describes how to run &kvm; &vmhost; on the &alp; (&alpshort;).

listitem.para: When running &alpshort; in a virtualized environment, you need to enable the nested &kvm; virtualization on the bare-metal host operating system and use kernel-default kernel instead of the default kernel-default-base in &alpshort;.

section.title: Starting the &kvm; workload
section.para: &alpshort; can serve as a host running virtual machines. The following procedure describes steps to prepare the &alpshort; host to run containerized &kvm; &vmhost; and run an example &vmguest; on top of it.

step.para: Pull the image from the registry and install all the wrapper scripts:
Create the libvirtd container from the downloaded image:
Optionally, run a &vmguest; on top of the started &kvm; &vmguest; using the virt-install-demo.sh script.

tip.para: virt-install-demo.sh uses the openSUSE-Tumbleweed-JeOS.x86_64-OpenStack-Cloud.qcow2 image by default. To specify another VM image, modify the APPLIANCE_MIRROR and APPLIANCE options in the /etc/kvm-container.conf file.
virsh is a wrapper script to launch the virsh command inside the container. The default container name is libvirtd.
virt-manager is a wrapper script to launch the virt-manager graphic interface to manage virtual machines. The xauth package must be installed on the host server for the virt-manager to run.
